page.title: 09Pollution of the Ellerbrook.
page.content: On 16th May 1985 the Ormskirk Advertiser carried an article about pollution of the Ellerbrook stream, Lathom. The matter was raised by Councillor Ronnie Barker at the Annual Meeting of the parish council. He claimed animals had suffered injury after going into the Ellerbrook. These injuries, dating back to August 1984, included a dog which suffered burns and loss of fur after entering the stream. Councillor Barker added that minnows were seen in the Ellerbrook the previous spring but this spring there is nothing. One of the sources of the pollution could be coming from the Hattersley Newman Fender factory in Ormskirk. There is a ditch leading from the factory into Burscough.
